revised_title: Adsorption of Non-Polar Substances: Entropy and Heat of Adsorption
tldr: This article investigates the entropy and heat of adsorption of non-polar substances, such as benzene, toluene, and heptane, on mercury surfaces. The authors explore the translational and rotational freedom of these substances on the surface and derive theoretical heat of adsorption values. The findings provide insights into the nature of adsorbed films and the freedom experienced by molecules on mercury surfaces.
